question: What does it mean when the LED display flashes yellow In Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones? Select the correct answer from A, B, C, D. Only one answer is correct. A) Battery charge is 0 % to 20 %. B) Battery charge is 90 % to 100 %. C) Battery charge is 20 % to 90 %. D) Headphones are in Bluetooth pairing mode
ground_truth: C) Battery charge is 20 % to 90 %.
answer: C) Battery charge is 20 % to 90 %.
contexts:

• are switched on or off,
• are in pairing mode (melody),
• detect devices in the pairing list,

When the headphones are being charged, the LED display lights up 
(> 10). Once the headphones are fully charged, the LEDs flash white 
for approx. 5 minutes and then go off. When the battery charge drops 
to a low level, the voice prompt “Recharge headset” asks you to 
recharge the headphones. If the headphones are not charged, the 
voice prompt will be repeated every 10 minutes until the headphones 
switch off.

question: Is it possible to setup voice prompt? If yes, how to do that in Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones?
ground_truth: Yes, it is possible. To set up the voice prompts you require the Smart Control App (>18). In the app settings, you can activate voice prompts and sound signals (also the default setting) or deactivate them.
answer: Yes, it is possible to set up voice prompts in the Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones. To do so, you need to use the Smart Control app where you can activate or deactivate voice prompts and sound signals.
contexts:
Using the headphones
ACCENTUM  |  19
Switching the headphones off
▷ Press the main button for 3 seconds.
You hear a sound signal. The LED flashes red 3x. The headphones 
switch off.
Make sure that Bluetooth is already activated on your Blue-
tooth device when switching on the headphones.
If Bluetooth is activated and the headphones cannot find a 
paired Bluetooth device within a few minutes, you hear the 
voice prompt “No connection”. The LED flashes red 3x. The

settings are active even without using the Smart Control app, i.e. 
when you are using a different Bluetooth device.
Setting the voice prompts/sound signals
To be able to set the voice prompts and sound signals, you require 
the Smart Control app (> 18).
In the app settings, you can activate voice prompts and sound sig-
nals (default setting) or deactivate them completely.
Deactivating the touch pad function
To avoid unintentional entries via the touch pad of the headphones,

Using the headphones
30  |  ACCENTUM
Using the voice assistant/voice dialing
The voice assistant is only available when the headphones and the 
mobile device are connected via Bluetooth or USB. Some smart-
phones or music players may not support all functions.
▷ Press the main button 1x.
The available voice assistant of your mobile device is activated 
(depending on the system used or app installed on your mobile 
device: Siri, Google Assistant or others. If no voice assistant is

question: When do I replace the ear pads and where can I find the replacement ear pads for Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones?
ground_truth: There is no specific timeframe for ear pad replacement. For hygiene reasons, you should replace your ear pads from time to time. Replacement ear pads are available at www.sennheiser-hearing.com/accentum-wireless.
answer: You should replace the ear pads of the Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones from time to time for hygiene reasons. Replacement ear pads can be found at www.sennheiser-hearing.com/accentum-wireless for online purchase or through your local Sonova Consumer Hearing partner.
contexts:
to time. Spare ear pads are available at  
www.sennheiser-hearing.com/accentum-wireless (to purchase 
online or contact your local Sonova Consumer Hearing partner: 
www.sennheiser-hearing.com/service-support)
▷ Peel the ear pad up and away from the ear cup.
▷ Assign the right ear pad to the right ear cup and the left ear pad 
to the left ear cup.
▷ Place the new ear pad onto the ear cup.
▷ Press the ear pad onto the ear cup so that the ear pad is fixed in 
the notch of the ear cup.
CAUTION

Care and maintenance
34  |  ACCENTUM
Care and maintenance
▷ Clean the parts of the product only with a soft, dry cloth.
To clean the charging socket:
▷ Blow vigorously over the charging socket. 
▷ If necessary, carefully remove any stuck dirt from the charging 
socket using a dry, soft brush or a dry interdental brush. Only 
apply gentle pressure when doing so.
Replacing the ear pads
For reasons of hygiene, you should replace your ear pads from time 
to time. Spare ear pads are available at

question: What is the charging time of the rechargeable battery in Momentum 4 Wireless Around Ear Headphones?
ground_truth: Approximately 2 hours
answer: The charging time of the rechargeable battery in Momentum 4 Wireless Around Ear Headphones is approximately 2 hours.
contexts:
Using the headphones
MOMENTUM 4  | 13
Using the headphones
Information on the rechargeable battery 
and the charging process
The headphones have a built-in rechargeable battery. A complete 
charging cycle takes approx. 2 hours. The charging time can vary 
depending on the power source used and the ambient temperature. 
Before using the headphones for the first time, charge the recharge-
able battery for a complete charging cycle without interruption.

Using the earbuds
18 | MOMENTUM True Wireless 4
Charging the rechargeable batteries 
wirelessly
1. Open the charging case by over coming a slight magnetic resis-
tance and insert the left earbud into the left charging compart-
ment and the right earbud into the right charging compartment.
The earbuds are magnetically pulled into the charging compart-
ments.
2. Place the bottom of the charging case centered on a wireless 
charging station (Qi-compatible, to be ordered separately).

Using the earbuds
16 | MOMENTUM True Wireless 4
Using the earbuds
Information on the rechargeable battery, 
the charging process and the first use
The earbuds and the charging case each have a built-in rechargeable 
battery. 
To charge the rechargeable batteries, you can use one of the follow-
ing options:
•t h e  s u p p l i e d  U S B  c a b l e
• a wireless charging station (Qi-compatible, to be ordered sepa-
rately)
The earbuds must be inserted into the charging case for charging.

question: How many audio sources can I connect at the same time to the BTT100 Audio transmitter?
ground_truth: You can simultaneously connect 2 different sources to the transmitter.
answer: You can connect up to eight Bluetooth headphones to the BTT100 Audio transmitter at the same time.

Your Bluetooth® Audio Transmitter allows digital audio streaming using 
only PCM audio output from devices connected through the digital optical

function can be deactivated.

of the transmitter. 
 X Connect the other end of the analog audio cable to the 3.5 mm

question: What happens to the LED light colour when I switch the transmitter on and how do I know whether a connection is established in BTT100 Bluetooth Audio Transmitter?
ground_truth: The LED lights up red when the transmitter is switched on and once the connection is established, the LED lights up blue.
answer: When you switch the transmitter on in the BTT100 Bluetooth Audio Transmitter, the LED initially lights up red. Once the connection is established, the LED changes to blue, indicating a successful connection.

2. Switch the transmitter on.
The LED lights up red. Once the connection is established, the LED 
lights up blue.

question: What does 'Podcast' voice prompt mean in Momentum Sport?
ground_truth: Equalizer preset for podcasts is activated (improved speech intelligibility).
answer: I don't know.
contexts:
Product overview
14 | MOMENTUM Sport
Notes on voice prompts
The earbuds output voice prompts for events (the table gives some 
examples). Using the Smart Control app, you can choose between 
voice prompts and beep sounds, or deactivate the status messages 
with a few exceptions (e.g. rechargeable battery is empty). 
Voice prompt Meaning
“Power on” Earbuds are switched on.
“Power off” Earbuds switch off.
“Connected” Earbuds are connected via Blue-
tooth.

question: What should you do to reset MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 earbuds to factory settings?
ground_truth: To reset, disconnect all Bluetooth connections, place one earbud in the charging case, and hold the touch panel of the other earbud for 15 seconds.
answer: To reset MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 earbuds to factory settings, you can use the Smart Control app or manually proceed by following the instructions provided in the user manual.

question: In the scenario 1 in Network whitepaper what is the only component needing active configuration?
ground_truth: The only component needing active configuration is the SRV-record in the DNS-Server
answer: The only component needing active configuration in Scenario 1 in the Network whitepaper is the SRV-record in the DNS-Server.
contexts: Scenarios for network integration Scenario 1 - One port solution  In this scenario, all components (MobileConnect Station, MobileConnect Manager, MobileConnect App clients) are part of the same network. Advantages • Easy to setup • No additional hardware/software needed  Disadvantages • The server with the MobileConnect Manager is

question: Why does the first ruleset disallow all access using IPv6?
ground_truth: Because MobileConnect Manager is currently only supporting IPv4
answer: The first ruleset disallows all access using IPv6 because the MobileConnect Manager is currently only supporting IPv4.
contexts: expect a global configuration file to be located at /etc/mcm-iptables.conf. An example file:            Please note that not every option is used in every ruleset. The first ruleset disallows all access using IPv6, as the MobileConnect Manager is currently only supporting IPv4. Using this ruleset is recommended.

The second ruleset allows to add limitations for the ports used for accessing the MobileConnect Manager web interface and for the interfaces used by the MobileConnect Stations. This increases the maintenance overhead, as it needs all MAC addresses of the MobileConnect Stations and the IP addresses of the systems allowed access to the web interface to be added to the configuration file. Nonetheless this configuration is recommended in the one-port setup. As an alternative to this, have

In this case, the ﬁrst WSM being registered in the network owns all access rights. In order 
to avoid any collisions, you should deactivate access to the devices for all other WSMs (see 
Withdrawing access rights from a WSM
).
If you should assign “Exclusive” access right to several WSMs, then access is 
random. The WSM which registers quicker with the device owns all access rights. 
This can, under certain circumstances, lead to confusion during operation.

question: What are the two modes of operation for MobileConnect, and how do they differ?
ground_truth: The two modes are Standalone Mode and Manager Mode. Standalone Mode is easier to set up with minimal IT support, focusing on audio streaming via QR codes without internet connectivity. Manager Mode offers full functionality with IT infrastructure, DNS setup, and centralized administration.
answer: Manager Mode and Standalone Mode are the two modes of operation for MobileConnect. Manager Mode offers the full range of functions but requires the setup of the MobileConnect Manager Software and DNS entries, needing IT support. It allows settings and administration for all MobileConnect Stations in the network from a single point of administration. Standalone Mode, on the other hand, operates independently without the need for constant internet connectivity or the MobileConnect Manager Software setup.
contexts:
3 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
 
System  Sennheiser MobileConnect allows streaming live audio content with low latency and in superior quality via WiFi to connected Android and iOS smart devices. To ensure low latency and superior audio quality, unicast is used for streaming.  Application Modes  To adapt to different application scenarios and network environments, MobileConnect can be operated in two Modes: Manager Mode and Standalone Mode.  Mode Differentiation

10 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
 Two port solution  In this scenario there are two separate networks. One is used for the public devices, the other is used for control of the MobileConnect Station and access to the MobileConnect Manager web interface.  
Using two separate networks employs a clear separation between streaming and control communication, allowing for a better confinement of the user controlled mobile devices.   Wi-Fi

Manager Mode offers the full range of functions but requires the setup of the MobileConnect Manager Software and DNS entries. This Mode therefor requires IT support. Settings and administration for all MobileConnect Stations in the network can be done using the Manager as single point of administration from anywhere in the network. Manager Mode requires constant internet connectivity.

question: What is required for using MobileConnect in Standalone Mode?
ground_truth: An enterprise-grade router, access point(s), and a local network with DHCP enabled are required. Streams are accessed using QR codes.
answer: For using MobileConnect in Standalone Mode, you need to connect it to a network infrastructure and operate it via the Local Admin Interface. Users have to scan the QR-Code created in the Local Admin Interface to connect to streams. Limited IT support is required, and the system components are the MobileConnect Station and MobileConnect App.
contexts: With Standalone Mode, MobileConnect focuses on its central audio streaming function. After connecting it to a network infrastructure, it is ready to operate. Setup and installation effort are simplified in this mode, only basic IT support is required. All settings and administration are done via the Local Admin Interface. To connect to streams, users have to scan the QR-Code created in the Local Admin Interface.

In this mode, the MobileConnect Station and MobileConnect App are the system components.   Considerations  
ü Ease of installation ü Limited IT support required – Manager functionalities not available – Streams can only be accessed via QR-Code   
Setup Overview  Setting up MobileConnect in Standalone Mode requires the following steps: 
 The target application for Standalone Mode is the equipment of a single room (or multiple single rooms) with live audio streams.

4 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
 Standalone Mode              Manager Mode                
  A decision for a mode is not final. A switch in any direction is possible at any time. In many cases it is advisable to use the Standalone Mode as entry mode for testing streaming functionality and switch to Manager Mode once the system is tested and its function has been approved.

question: How does MobileConnect handle data load per client in Standalone Mode?
ground_truth: The data load is 165 kbps per unique client connection.
answer: The data load per unique client connection in Standalone Mode is 165 kbps.
contexts:
6 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
Hardware  Minimum hardware requirements  
I Enterprise Grade Router  II Enterprise Grade Access Point(s)  Network  For Standalone Mode, a Wi-Fi network is required for transmission. Usage of an existing network infrastructure as well as the setup of a dedicated infrastructure is possible.   
The data load is 165 kbps per unique client connection.  DHCP is required.  Internet connectivity

With Standalone Mode, MobileConnect focuses on its central audio streaming function. After connecting it to a network infrastructure, it is ready to operate. Setup and installation effort are simplified in this mode, only basic IT support is required. All settings and administration are done via the Local Admin Interface. To connect to streams, users have to scan the QR-Code created in the Local Admin Interface.

Wi-Fi  
MobileConnect relies on Wi-Fi to transmit streams to connected smartphones. The quality of the Wi-Fi is directly influencing the service’s quality and performance.   
Quality of Service is recommended.  Usage of 5 GHz band is recommended.  The recommended limit of number of clients per AP is 50.  
 
The term Standalone Mode refers to the MobileConnect Station, not the network infrastructure. MobileConnect does not handle network organization.

question: What network recommendation is critical for using MobileConnect?
ground_truth: The use of the 5 GHz Wi-Fi band is recommended for better performance and reduced interference.
answer: It is critical to use the same Wi-Fi network for MobileConnect if an existing network is available. Adding an additional Wi-Fi network may cause interference and lower the quality of service. Usage of the 5 GHz band is recommended, and a minimum data rate of 12 Mbps is also recommended.
contexts: If a Wi-Fi network is existing, it is highly recommended to use the same network for MobileConnect. Adding an additional Wi-Fi network will likely cause interference and lower the quality of service. Additionally, usage of a separate network worsens user experiences because it forces users to decide between MobileConnect and the other network’s functionality.  Quality of Service is recommended.  Usage of 5 GHz band is recommended.  It is recommended to make 12 Mbps the lowest mandatory data

The quality of the offered service depends on the network and Wi-Fi infrastructure. It has to fulfil a minimum of requirements for MobileConnect. It is important to check network suitability prior to the integration.
The quality of the offered service depends on the network and Wi-Fi infrastructure. It has to fulfil a minimum of requirements for MobileConnect.

question: What is the recommended Wi-Fi configuration for optimal performance of MobileConnect?
ground_truth: It is recommended to use the 5 GHz band with a Quality of Service configuration. Each access point should ideally support a maximum of 50 clients, with a minimum data rate of 12 Mbps.
answer: The recommended Wi-Fi configuration for optimal performance of MobileConnect includes using Quality of Service, utilizing the 5 GHz band, and limiting the number of clients per AP to 50. It is also recommended to use the same Wi-Fi network for MobileConnect if an existing network is available to avoid interference and ensure a better user experience.
contexts:

Quality of Service is recommended.  Usage of 5 GHz band is recommended.  The recommended limit of number of clients per AP is 50.  
 
The term Standalone Mode refers to the MobileConnect Station, not the network infrastructure. MobileConnect does not handle network organization.

If a Wi-Fi network is existing, it is highly recommended to use the same network for MobileConnect. Adding an additional Wi-Fi network will likely cause interference and lower the quality of service. Additionally, usage of a separate network worsens user experiences because it forces users to decide between MobileConnect and the other network’s functionality.  Quality of Service is recommended.  Usage of 5 GHz band is recommended.  It is recommended to make 12 Mbps the lowest mandatory data

question: What is the water resistance rating of the Apple AirPods Pro 2?
ground_truth: I don't know
answer: The Apple AirPods Pro 2 have an IP55 water resistance rating.

Important safety instructions
MOMENTUM Sport  | 3
Safety instructions for Lithium rechargeable batteries
Notes on the ingress protection rating of the earbuds
The earbuds feature an IP55 ingress protection rating which means 
they are protected from the ingress of water (protection class 
according to International Protection Marking (IP code), IEC standard 
60529, tested under laboratory conditions). The charging case has 
an IP54 protection rating and is protected against dust and splash

Notes on the ingress protection rating of the earbuds
The earbuds feature an IP54 ingress protection rating which means 
they are protected from the ingress of water (protection class 
according to International Protection Marking (IP code), IEC standard 
60529, tested under laboratory conditions).
